reviewText: Product received for free\n\nCool classic arcade style game, grungy feeling from old arcade machines and magic of scanlines effect, followed by awesome 8bit music style. It really throw you back in the day by playing it, even if it seem easy.... I died like 10 times in first 5 minutes, which is good and hard, also there is a lot more things that can kill you than it seem.. I noticed that a bit too late. Anyway great small game, I still enjoy playing it, it won\'t just collect dust i my steam library.

Product received for free

Star Drifter is a combination of pixel graphics with modern visual effects which looks nice. The music is really good.
But for me the best thing in this game was the retro feeling from old games.

reviewText: Played for a while, found it pretty entertaining. Though I came about far too late to enjoy the arcade experience this game is trying to emulate, it's still an enjoyable scrolling shooter.\n\nI like the novel idea of being able to continue after your ship is shot down (even though it took a few seconds after it happened for me to even realize it; I should probably do more reading before I play a game).
voteText: 5 of 6 people (83%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Product received for free\n\nWow what a rush of nostalgia! You can see that a lot of love and passion went into the making of this game. The graphics and sounds are just right for the genre, and the gameplay is very fast and fluid. And yes, very difficult! Now all it needs is controller support, but even without, I'd still recommend! Although I got the game for free, I'd easily pay the one dollar for this :)
voteText: 5 of 6 people (83%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Expectations exceeded!

Don't expect Star Drifter to play like a £0.79 game, everything is done very well and feels solid, the music is good, the graphics are good, the controls are good (given its key based).

If you like high difficulty shooters and can get on with key controls, I think you'll dig it!
voteText: 5 of 6 people (83%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
This game is the love child of Galaga and Radiant with a mix of Radian feel.

This is a rapid pace game which relies heavily on power-ups and upgrades to your ship, with additional weapons to be purchased from the in-game store to help you fight your way against the endless hoard. The Store front is hard to see at certain times, being a light blue color on top of many bright objects could be a pain to see what of 3 tabs your on. Tabs included Weapons/Ship/Upgrades. As you defeat enemies, \cash" is dropped and you buy upgrades when it says it is available to buy via the indicater on the top left of the screen.

Complaints:
As of this review
date: you cannot reassign keys.\nMenus are chunky;The exit menu while playing the game keeps on going leaving you to do as you exit. (Bug/Exploit: Exitting whle playing will remove all points and level area upon returning
recommended: but the lives/levels and upgrades are kept)And navigating the store is a pain
voteText: even though there is 3 choices. Selecting upgrades via an up/down menu is useful
helpfulPercent: but when getting on later levels
votesFunny: your in the same place where you left off
commentsCount: meaning you have to scroll all the way back down.\n\nAlso
column16: Many things are red. MANY THINGS! A coin is both yellow and red
column17: with the red one dropping more. You know what looks like a coin? Those slow moving explosive dots that look like a coin with a trail
column18:
palette changes would be nice or a new section to say what upgrades do and what to avoid.

OverAll:
You'll get a good hour or two worth of fun in one sitting. Steady and fast gameplay. You could get out of your vechile when it gets downed at some point(Don't know how or why). It's a vertical shooter
column19: with nice graphics and upgrades\n\nAlso Steam Trading Cards

reviewText: Still a bit rough on the edges but could end up as a little gem to its genre.\nBe aware that this game is supposed to be hard! While the upside is it certainly feels rewarding to get better the obvious downside to it will be that casuals go boohoo
date: mommy!" when playing this.\nYou basically level up by popping meanies from outer space
recommended: the higher your level gets the better the items available in the shop will be. While that is certainly nothing new it seems to be done in a very solid way.\n\nKeep in mind that updates bought in a certain playcycle won't become a part of the next
hoursPlayed: thus you start from point zero each time again
